question.title: ClassNotFoundException for javax.xml.ws.Service after upgrading Spring Boot
question.body:
We have a project with Java 17, Spring Boot 2.7.18 and Spring 5.3.37. I upgraded it to Spring Boot to 3.4.3 and Spring to 6.2.3. When the application was run, a ClassNotFoundException (for the class javax.xml.ws.Service) was thrown by one of my company's internal library. I tried searching for a solution, and it seems that the recommended solution was to download the dependencies com.sun.xml.ws:jaxws-rt and com.sun.xml.ws:rt. Below is one of the links I found.

ClassNotFoundException: javax.xml.ws.Service

I have downloaded these two dependencies, but they didn't make any difference when the application is run. The same exception is still thrown. What I don't really get it is this: why were these two dependencies suggested when they both don't contain the class javax.xml.ws.Service?

Is finding a newer version of the internal library that is throwing the exception my only solution?
